cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 40 mi NE of Freeport, Grand Bahama Island and 110 mi ENE of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly lifting north-northwest today, turning north Wednesday, then accelerating north-northeast just off the U.S. East Coast toward the Carolinas, Mid-Atlantic offshore waters, and Atlantic Canada
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or over the North Carolina Outer Banks

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane / Tropical-storm watches presently extend from north of Deerfield Beach FL to South Santee River SC (FL–GA–SC coasts)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and storm-surge warnings from Jupiter Inlet FL to Ponte Vedra Beach FL; storm-surge warning Lantana FL to Savannah River GA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast, Georgia, South Carolina, North Carolina, then offshore Mid-Atlantic and New England coasts
weather_observation.wind: Low (≈6%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds; gusts mainly 25–35 mph possible Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected in New York Harbor based on current track
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of rain 1–2 inches with localized heavier squalls late Friday–Saturday
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents beginning late week
